Welcome to Rest API’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

REST API repository Contacts¶

async repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, user: User, db: Session) → Contact¶

Creates new contact for specific user.

Parameters:

  • body (ContactModel) – The data for the contact to create.

  • user (User) – User for which contact will create.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

Returns:

Created contact.

Return type:

Contact

async repository.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Contact | None¶

Deletes specific contact for specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – Contact id of the contact to delete.

  • user (User) – User for which contact will delete.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

Returns:

Deleted contact, or None if contact does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

async repository.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session) → Contact | None¶

Gets specific contact for specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – Contact id of the searching contact.

  • user (User) – User for which contact will retrieve.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

Returns:

Contact by specific id, or None if contact does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

async repository.contacts.get_contacts(name: str, lastname: str, email: str, user: User, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶

Gets list of all contacts for specific user.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – First name of the contact (OPTIONAL).

  • lastname (str) – Last name of the contact (OPTIONAL).

  • email (str) – Email address of the contact (OPTIONAL).

  • user (User) – User for which contacts will retrieve.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

Returns:

List of contacts.

Return type:

List[Contact]

async repository.contacts.get_contacts_with_nearest_birthday(user: User, db: Session) → List[Contact]¶

Gets list of contacts whose birthday in the nearest week.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – User for which contacts will retrieve.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

Returns:

List of contacts.

Return type:

List[Contact]

async repository.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactModel, user: User, db: Session) → Contact | None¶

Updates specific contact for specific user.

Parameters:

  • contact_id (int) – Contact id of the contact to update.

  • body (ContactModel) – Data to update in contact.

  • user (User) – User for which contact will update.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

Returns:

Updated contact, or None if contact does not exist.

Return type:

Contact | None

REST API repository Users¶

async repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

Confirms email for specific user.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – Email address.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

Returns:

None.

Return type:

None

async repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session) → User¶

Creates new user.

Parameters:

  • body (UserModel) – Data for contact.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

Returns:

Created user.

Return type:

User

async repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User¶

Gets user by email address.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – Email address.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

Returns:

User.

Return type:

User

async repository.users.update_avatar(email: str, url: str, db: Session) → User¶

Updates avatar for specific user.

Parameters:

  • email (str) – Email address.

  • url (str) – Cloudinary URL address.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

Returns:

Updated user.

Return type:

User

async repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: Session) → None¶

Updates refresh token for specific user.

Parameters:

  • user (User) – User for which token will update.

  • token (str | None) – Refresh token.

  • db (Session) – Database session.

Returns:

None.

Return type:

None
